text:
Hi guys,
I had a uncommon request from one of our clients this morning. 
There is a custom form (non-HubSpot) which sign visitors to their external app and they want to add a hidden field that monitors the quality of leads, basically they want to see where that visitor came from. 
Is there a json variable that has that kind of data that I can use to populate the value of that hidden form?
what do you suggest?
Thanks

Hi. 

Really happy to be here! :nerd_face:  I need your help. Someone who is expert about tabbing / tabindex? I have never implement tabbing before and I tried it in HubSpot, but it doesn’t work.

Do you have any tip? Hope you can give me script, CSS, or “step by step-manual” :innocent: :pray: 
Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi <@UB58JNMQR>  Here is a basic example that I fast found on W3Schools <https://www.w3schools.com/howto/tryit.asp?filename=tryhow_js_tabs>

hope is going to help you
Oh, it is not that I mean
You know, people who are blind must “read” websites with tab (sorry I am not expert in English, so maybe you are using another words for that.)

I just had a look on the internet (because I have never developed and accessibility website ) and I found this article <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3670570/getting-screen-reader-to-read-new-content-added-with-javascript?utm_medium=organic&utm_source=google_rich_qa&utm_campaign=google_rich_qa>

it says WAI-ARIA might be able to do it <https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/>
but again I am not sure if there is going to be a sound on it.

if is just a focus thing (with no sound), this article can demonstrate it and guides you on how to <https://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/tabindex>

`{{ request.referrer }}` sounds like what you’re looking for.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-variables#http-request-variables>

<@UB58JNMQR> one of the best resources for accessibility information is <https://a11yproject.com/>

It has sample code
i'd like to upload an image to use a the background of a div. can someone point me in the right direction?
<@UB380RRMM> Your looking to upload an image to your HubSpot portal via file manager?
yes, it will be a landing page. i want to give the user an option to upload an image and then write the template so that its a background image
right now, the only way i can think of is to have them one after another and then use absolute positioning.. but it seems silly
also, i want to be able to use css styles like background-position:cover;
You can definitely do this with a module.  Create an image field and then write inline background-image style to the div referencing the field you created.
i.e. ```<div class="yourLandingDiv" style="background-image: url('{{ module.image_field.src }}');"> div contents here </div>```
